description.narrative: Education for Active Citizenship, EfAC, is a national project aiming which contributes to strengthening civil society organizations, poor and marginalized children, particularly girls and young women, to improve quality education and by promoting, demanding andachieving individual and collective rights trough formal and non-formal quality education, enabling a structural, political and social change in Mozambique. Generally, the project It aims to contribute that citizens use their voices actively at national and local level to influence transparent and accountable domestic resource mobilization and promote quality services for inclusive and equitable quality education in Mozambique. This change willhappen if: i) The transformative potential of education is realized by using innovative and gender-sensitive strategies, models and approaches that are tested and documented and used as basis for policy influencing work focusing on promoting equity and on improving the learning opportunities of disadvantaged groups such as girls and youth in rural areas. II) Oxfam's partners, including emerging civil society (e.g. organized members of school councils) and groups representing marginalized women and youth, have increased their knowledge, role and capacity,positioning themselves and holding duty bearers accountable in education budgeting, planning and governance at school/district/provincial level. The project will be implemented in Mozambique through relevant partners at National level (Monimento de Educação para Todos-MEPT); at local Level (NANA - Associação de Apoio ao Desenvolvimento), and relevant stakeholders at both national (Maputo) and local level (Zambezia Province ) with potential to expand to other areas of the country. Oxfam's role in this project will be facilitating the institutional capacity of CSOs, promoting horizontal and vertical links between organizations and establishing links between CSOs and stakeholders, donors and other partners in order to maximize project results and strengthen the power and influence of CSOs . Studies and research will be widely used as evidence to bring about lastingchanges in citizens' lives.

participating-org.narrative: Oxfam Novib is one of the 17 national affiliates of the Oxfam International Confederation. It started life in 1956 as the Netherlands Organisation for International Assistance (Novib), and joined forces with Oxfam in 1994. Working together in confederation, the Oxfam affiliates can speak with one clear and compelling voice on issues of global concern: climate change, health and education forall, agriculture, trade, and conflicts and emergencies. Oxfam established this country office to support local organizations and projects. Through this local office Oxfam Novib directly contributes towards this project’s implementation.

mailing-address.narrative: PO box 30919, 2500 GX The Hague, The Netherlands

sector.narrative: The right to social and political participation
